Texas Scholarships


(Tex) Stayton Gillett Ward Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Angelo State University College of Sciences Department of Agriculture majoring in Animal Science. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

1926 Study Club Scholarship
The 1926 Study Club met as the oldest women’s club in Hockley County for more than 75 years before it disbanded. The club established a scholarship fund in 1988 to benefit a history-government student. Minimum qualifications include: 2.50 grade point average; full-time enrollment (12 semester hours or more); and U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Students are selected for the award by the faculty of the Social Science Department. more...

1999 Senior Challenge Text Book Scholarship
Scholarship for seniors attending Virginia Polytechnic Institute & State University (Virginia Tech) who are majoring in Engineering. Selection based on academic achievement and financial need. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

2000-2001 Richmond Hokie Club Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Virginia Polytechnic Institute & State University (Virginia Tech) who participate in the schools intercollegiate athletic program. Selection based on academic achievement and talent. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

2018-2019 First Year Leader Award
Students must be nominated by a UT Arlington faculty/ staff person and must have received communication from the Follett Student Leadership Center to apply for this scholarship. A student must be actively involved in at least one organization and have assumed a leadership role or responsibilities in some capacity within the organization while maintaining a minimum G.P.A. of 2.25.
Applicant must be a first-time nominee and classified as a freshman/ first year student having begun their first year at UTA in the summer/fall 2018. more...

2018-2019 Second Year Leader Award
UT Arlington students must be nominated by a faculty/ staff person. Students must have received notification from the Follett Student Leadership Center to apply for the scholarship. A student must be actively involved in at least one organization and have assumed a leadership role or responsibilities in some capacity within the organization while maintaining a minimum G.P.A. of 2.25.
Applicant must be classified as a sophomore/ second year having begun their second year at UTA in the summer/fall 2018. more...

4-G Investments, Ltd. Endowed Presidents Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Texas A&M; International University, majoring in Business or International Trade. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

80/20 Endowed Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students attending ACC.
Criteria:
• Minimum 2.5 GPA in high school or college or submit a GED.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office).
Terms of Scholarship:
1. May be used for any program at ACC that leads to a certificate or associate degree.
2. Successfully complete a minimum of six hours each semester with a 2.50 GPA.
3. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees and books.
4. Scholarship must be used within one academic year.
5. Re-application necessary each academic year. more...

A Diamond In Our Eyes: The Sade Lowery Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship will be given to full-time students majoring in Music Education. Recipients must also demonstrate financial need and be members in good standing with an instrumental ensemble. more...

A Hand Up Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship will be given to full-time undergraduate or graduate (master or doctorate level) who are in good standing at Tarleton State University, majoring in one of the following majors/areas of study: engineering, computer science, construction science or engineering technology, biological sciences, chemistry, physics, or mathematics, pre-nursing, nursing, nursing administration or nursing education, or criminal justice. more...

A+ Federal Credit Union Endowed Scholarship
Purpose: To provide assistance to students planning to enter the teaching field.
Criteria:
• Minimum 3.0 GPA in all college work. Students coming out of high school or holding a GED must achieve a 3.0 GPA their first semester to maintain the scholarship.
• May only be used by students planning to enter the teaching field through the Austin Community College Associate of Arts in Teaching program.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office).
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Successfully complete a minimum of six hours each semester while on scholarship and earn a minimum semester GPA of 3.0.
2. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees and books.
3. Scholarship must be used within one academic year.
4. Re-application necessary each academic year. more...

A+ Scholarship
The President's Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Arlington Baptist University. You must be a resident of Tarrant, Dallas, Denton, Johnson, Parker, Wise, or Ellis County and have a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

A. Alan & Marie Z. Montrose Educational Fund
Annual award for full-time undergraduate students, (freshmen not eligible), who have completed at least one year at the University of Texas - El Paso. Students must be U.S. Citizens/Permanent Residents, have above average GPA and financial need. Due date, award amount and number of awards vary. more...

A. B. And Irene Rogers Aquatic Biology Scholarship (Sr6263)
History:
This scholarship was established to honor the memory of A. B. and Irene S. Rogers and provide financial assistance to students pursuing a degree in the Aquatic Biology program.
Eligibility:
Aquatic Biology major
Junior- or senior-level undergraduate (completed 60 credit hours or more by the previous August)
TX State GPA of at least 3.0
Full-time enrollment more...

Scholarship for residents of Franklin County, Virginia who are undergraduate students attending Virginia Polytechnic Institute & State University (Virginia Tech). Selection based on academic achievement. Award amount and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

A. D. Hutchison Student Endowment Fellowship
The A. D. Hutchison Student Endowment Fellowship is open to current graduate students at the University of Texas at Austin. Awards are based on major accomplishments since entering graduate school, a well-defined program of research, strong personal statement and letters of recommendation. more...

Aage & Margareta Moller Scholarship For Veterans Of The War In Iraq & Afghanistan
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Texas-Dallas. Students must have served on active duty in the War in Iraq or Afghanistan. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Aaron And Barbara Smith Music Scholarship
This scholarship is to benefit upper classman who are Music majors with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. more...

Aauw Lea Ledger Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for female residents residing in the Copperas Cove ISD boundaries and are undergraduate students enrolling in Central Texas College at the district campus or service area. Applicant must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and financial need. Preference given to students who already have some credit hours. In addition to application student must submit a financial aid form, academic transcript, and a 300 word essay outlining goals, academic achievement, and community service. Applicants need only to fill out one scholarship application form for any or all of the awards the Foundation offers. Contact the Financial Aid Office for more information and/or application. more...

Ab Medlen Scholarship
This scholarship will be given to a deserving full-time student in good standing with the university, majoring in biology and has completed 30 hours of university credit. more...

Abell-Hanger Nursing Awards
Scholarship for graduating Texas high school seniors who have participated in a University Interscholastic League (UIL) Academic State Meet contest and are planning to attend, full-time, and will be pursuing a degree in Nursing at an accredited Texas college/university the fall semester after graduation. Students who competed in past State Meets as underclassmen and are now graduating may also apply. Consideration is also given to leadership abilities, participation in school and community activities and financial need. Applications are available for download on TILFs website, or are included in the One-Act Play participants passes packet, or may be picked up at the State Meet Registration Center, or student can send request for one beginning March 1st by sending a self-addressed (9-1/2x4) envelope with two first class stamps. Applications must be submitted and post-marked between April 1st and May 9th. Renewable. more...

Academic Achievement-Diveristy Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen or transfer students enrolling at Washington State University. Selection based on academic achievements, financial need, and community service. Award amount and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Academic Distinction Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at the University of Texas-Dallas. Consideration may be given to extracurricular activities, community service, work experience, and leadership skills. Award amount is for full tuition. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Academic Excellence Award
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors planning to attend the University of Houston. Applicants must rank in the top 15% of their high school graduating class or have a minimum 3.5 GPA, have a minimum SAT score of 1200 or a minimum ACT score of 27. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Academic Excellence Award (Aea)
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to Texas Lutheran University. Selection based on academic achievement and SAT/ACT scores. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Academic Excellence Award - Tlu
The Academic Excellence Award is available to entering freshmen at Texas Lutheran University. This award is renewable with a minimum 2.75 GPA. more...

Academic Excellence Scholarship
This scholarship is for entering freshman who receive an offer of admission to SFA by June 1 and are ranked in top 10% of graduating class or ranked in top 25% of graduating class with a minimum score of 1170 on SAT or 24 on ACT without writing. It is renewable for 3 years if specific criteria are met. No scholarship application necessary. more...

Academic Excellence Scholarship For National Merit Scholars
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at the University of Texas-Dallas. Students must be National Merit Scholars and list the University of Texas-Dallas as their first choice of school. Consideration may be given to extracurricular activities, community service, work experience, and leadership skills. Award amount is for full tuition. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Academic Freedom Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate or graduate student attending Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. Applicant must submit the best original essay on the topic The Role and Importance of Academic Freedom in the University. Essay must be no longer than 1,000 words, must be typed, and must submit three copies with application cover sheet. more...

Academic Freshman Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshmen attending Texas Christian University in Fort Worth, Texas. Applicant must have a minimum 3.25 GPA at the end of their freshman year. Number of awards varies. Renewable; must maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Academic Higher Recognition Scholarship
Scholarship for college freshmen enrolled full-time at the University of Texas-Dallas. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Academic Or Competitive Scholarship (Current Or Transfer Students)
Scholarship for undergraduate current or transfer students attending Texas A&M; International University full-time. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Academic Or Competitive Scholarship (Dd Hachar Honors)
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students attending Texas A&M; International University full-time. Applicants must qualify as a DD Hachar Honors student. Students must have a SAT score of 1100 or ACT score of 24 and graduate in the top 5% of their class. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Academic Or Competitive Scholarship (Incoming Freshmen)
Scholarship for incoming freshmen students attending Texas A&M; International University full-time. Applicants must have SAT/ACT scores of at least 1030/22 or be in the top 30% of their graduating class, and must have taken THEA and passed all sections. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Academic Promise Scholarship
The Academic Promise Scholarship is available for students who plan to major in sociology (first preference) or psychology at South Plains College. The scholarship was established by Loy and Jana Daniel of Brownfield, Texas, and their son Brant Farrar of Lubbock, Texasm all three of whom are alumni of SPC. In addition, Mrs. Daniel and Mr. Farrar are professors at SPC teaching sociology in the Behavioral Science Department. The scholarship was named because of the promise SPC makes to support the success of students, as well as the promise scholarship recipients make to work to be successful in their coursework. In order to be considered, applicants must enroll in at lease 12 semester credit hours as a full-time student and have a minimum 2.50 grade point average. more...

Academic Recognition Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at the University of Texas-Dallas. Consideration may be given to extracurricular activities, community service, work experience, and leadership skills. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Academic Scholarship - Utep
The Academic Scholarship is available to incoming freshmen at the University of Texas at El Paso. You must have a minimum 93 high school average, graduate in the top ten percent of your class, and have a minimum 24 ACT/1120 SAT score to qualify for this award. more...

Acc Alumni Network Scholarship
Purpose: To assist full-time students pursuing a certificate or associate degree at ACC.
Criteria:
• Minimum 2.25/4.0 GPA or equivalent or submit a GED.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office). It is recommended students complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
• Essay should address how the scholarship will assist the student in becoming or continuing as a full-time student.
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Enroll in and complete a minimum of twelve hours with a 2.25 GPA each semester while on scholarship.
2. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, and books.
3. Scholarship must be used within the academic year it is awarded.
4. Scholarship may be renewed upon satisfactory academic progress, submission of a progress report, and application.
5. Scholarship may be awarded in addition to other scholarships or financial aid to assist the recipient in becoming or continuing as a full-time student. more...

Acc Counseling Services Scholarship
Purpose: In honor of Austin Community College District counselors, this scholarship recognizes students who seek professional guidance in achieving their educational goals.
Criteria:
• Students who have completed two or more semesters at ACC with a cumulative 2.5 GPA and 75% completion rate. Students who do not have the required cumulative GPA or completion rate, but who meet that standard for each of the last two semesters are eligible for this award.
• Received high school diploma or GED prior to entering ACC.
• Written recommendation and approved degree audit from at least one ACC counselor. If undecided, may submit counselor recommended plan, such as Core Curriculum courses.
• Complete and submit a Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA); information can be obtained in the Financial Aid Office. If you cannot submit this application, please explain the circumstances in your essay.
• Submit an essay of 300 words or more explaining educational and career goals, and how you have effectively reached out to others for guidance.
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Successfully complete at least six hours each semester while on scholarship and earn a semester GPA of 2.5 and completion rate of 75%.
2. Re-application necessary each year.
3. Meet with an ACC Counselor at least twice per semester while on scholarship.
4. Scholarship must be used within one academic year. more...

Acc Fast Track Ce Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students in the Continuing Education Fast Track programs at ACC.
Criteria:
• Enrolling in a Fast Track Continuing Education Program at ACC that leads to a license or industry certification.
• Scholarship is open to everyone, however, preference will be given to female applicants so long as such preference does not significantly detract from Austin Community College’s non-discriminatory policies.
• Financial need as determined by the Continuing Education Scholarship Committee.
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Successfully complete your approved Continuing Education Program.
2. Scholarship applies to the cost of the enrolled program. more...

Acc Foundation Open Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students attending ACC in a program leading to a certificate or associate degree.
Criteria:
• Minimum 2.5 GPA in high school or college or submit a GED.
• Students must be Pell eligible.
Terms of Scholarship:
1. May be used for any program at ACC that leads to a certificate or associate degree.
2. Successfully complete a minimum of six hours with a 2.5 GPA each semester.
3. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, books, and required supplies.
4. Scholarship must be used within one academic year. more...

Acc Riverbat Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students currently serving as a Riverbat mascot.
Criteria:
• Actively served as an ACC Riverbat mascot for a minimum of one semester.
• Minimum of 2.0 GPA in college work or have received their high school diploma or GED.
• Enrolled in a certificate or degree program at ACC.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office). It is recommended students complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Terms of Scholarship:
1. May be used for any program at ACC that leads to a certificate or associate degree or college transfer.
2. Successfully complete a minimum of six hours with a 2.0 GPA each semester while on scholarship
3. Scholarship must be used within one academic year. more...

Acc Texas Association Of Chicanos In Higher Education (Tache) Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students of Hispanic heritage attending ACC.
Criteria:
• Reside within the ACC service area.
• Have at least a 2.25 overall GPA or GED equivalency as a first-time, former, or current ACC student.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office).
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Successfully complete a minimum of six hours each semester with a 2.25 GPA.
2. Attend the TACHE scholarship reception.
3. Accept an ACC TACHE mentor.
4. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, and books.
5. Scholarship must be used within one academic year. more...

Accenture Scholarship
Scholarship for juniors or seniors attending Virginia Polytechnic Institute & State University (Virginia Tech) who are enrolled in the College of Engineering, the College of Business, or the College of Arts and Sciences. Selection based on academic achievement. Award amount and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Accounting Careers Scholarships
Scholarship for graduating Texas high school seniors who have participated in University Interscholastic League (UIL) Academic contests at the state level who are majoring in Accounting at a Texas college/university that participates in the Accounting Education Foundation of the Texas Society of Certified Public Accountants, Inc., programs. Students who competed in past State Meets as underclassmen and who are now graduating may also apply. Applicant must be a U.S. citizen, have a minimum SAT score of 1100 or minimum ACT score of 24, be in the top 10% of graduating class, and have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Consideration is also given to leadership abilities, participation in school and community activities and financial need. Applications are available for download on TILFs website, or are included in the One-Act Play participants passes packet, or may be picked up at the State Meet Registration Center, or student can send request for one beginning March 1st by sending a self-addressed (9-1/2x4) envelope with two first class stamps. Applications must be submitted and post-marked between April 1st and May 9th. Renewable. more...

Achieve Scholarship-Texas A & M University-Corpus Christi
The Achieve Scholarship is available to incoming freshman undergraduate students at Texas A & M University-Corpus Christi. You must have a converted minimum GPA of 4.00 to be eligible for this renewable award. more...

Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at Baylor University. Students must have a minimum 30 ACT score or a minimum 1300 SAT score. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Achievement Scholarship - Southwestern Adventist University
The Achievement Scholarship is open to entering full-time freshmen at Southwestern Adventist University. You must have an entrance score between 60 and 69.9. Multiple your GPA by 12.5 and add [ACT multiplied by 1.4 or SAT divided by 32] to determine your score. This award, combined with the Residence Hall scholarship equals $3,000. more...

Adams, Carrington, And West Art Scholarship
This scholarship is to benefit full time students who are majoring in Art, Art Education or Art History. Students must submit a portfolio of ten original works, or reproductions by either high quality photographic, digital or slide reproductions, to the School of Art Office within one week after the scholarship application deadline. The portfolio will be reviewed by the Scholarship Committee. In lieu of a portfolio, art education and art history majors must solicit and submit a letter of reference from one professor in their major that evaluates the promise shown in their major. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA in biology courses, completed a minimum of 12 credit hours but no more than 30, and completed one biology course at Kilgore College, and are enrolled in a second course. Nonrenewable. more...

Adult Career Scholars
Purpose: To assist students attending ACC.
Criteria:
• Financial Need (Students must complete FAFSA)
• GPA of 2.5
• Work Eligible
• 18+ years old
• Declared major (DMCAT, IT, Health Science)
Terms of Scholarship:
• GPA 2.5
• Minimum 8 credits (long semester)
• Remain in Target Major
Questions? Contact Oddett Garza-Weatherspoon at ogarzawe@austincc.edu This is a not an ACC Foundation scholarship. more...

Advanced Law Student Scholarship
Scholarship for graduate students in their second or third year attending Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas, majoring in Law. Selection is based on academic performance and financial need. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Advancement In Computer Science Promotion Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate sophomores or higher attending Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas, majoring in Computer Science. Applicants must have completed at least 30 hours with a minimum of 12 hours in computer science at Texas Tech with an overall GPA of 3.0 and a computer science GPA of 3.0 or better. Recipient cannot have more than $500 in other awards and must be a full-time student. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Advancing Healthcare In North Texas Endowed Scholarship Fund
Shall be used to award scholarships to undergraduate students who are enrolled in the *pre-licensure Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) * program and have demonstrated financial need. Students must have a minimum GPA of 2.75 and must maintain that minimum to be eligible for renewal scholarships. The scholarship may cover your entire tuition for one semester.
Eligibility:
Undergrad students pursuing BSN

2.75 GPA

Demonstrate financial need
A recommendation form must be completed by your faculty. You will need their name and email address. Once information is submitted, ScholarShop will send a link to the faculty to complete the recommendation form. Notify your faculty prior to providing their information on the application.* (It is your responsibility to ensure recommendation letter was submitted before this application closes. If not submitted, your application will not be considered.)*
*Note: All scholarship offer notifications will be sent via your UTA email account ONLY. Please check it frequently. Scholarships are not awarded in the summer. Applications submitted during the Spring are awarded in the Fall and applications submitted in the Fall are awarded in the Spring. After submitting your application, please confirm application was submitted. Only completed applications will be considered. *
Additional questions or concerns, email nursingscholarships@uta.edu. more...

Advertising Federation Scholarship

Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolling/enrolled in Central Texas College at the district campus or service area campuses who are majoring in Nursing. Applicant must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and financial need. In addition to application student must submit academic transcript and a 300 word essay outlining goals, academic achievement, and community service. Award is renewable if continuing criteria is met. Applicants need only to fill out one scholarship application form for any or all of the awards the Foundation offers. Albert And Doris June Melton Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship program was established by Stevan and Darlene Melton of Levelland in honor of Mr. Melton’s parents. Albert and Doris June grew up in farming families in the Pettiet area of Hockley County. A veteran of WWII, Albert returned to Levelland after the war and worked as a heavy equipment operation until his retirement. Doris June was among the first students to enroll at SPC when it opened in 1958. As a mother of two young children, she was part of a group of women who saw an opportunity to go to college. Mrs. Melton graduated from SPC in 1960 and went on to complete a bachelor’s and master’s degree at Texas Tech University. She taught 28 years in Levelland public schools before retiring. more...

Albert S. Lewie, Jr., earned a BBA (‘68) and an MBA (’69) from UTA and was a faculty member in the Management Department from 1970 to 1982. The fund was established by Albert “Sid” Lewie and his wife Scoot to recognize and reward deserving and academically promising College of Business students. more...

Alex Millican Memorial Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students enrolled in the Motion Graphics and 2D/3D Animation programs at ACC
Criteria:
• Pursuing an associate degree or certificate in Motion Graphics or 2D/3D Animation at ACC.
• Minimum 2.5 GPA in high school or college or submit a GED.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office).
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Student must be registered as a Motion Graphics or 2D/3D Animation major and taking coursework for that degree program.
2. Successfully complete a minimum of six hours with a 2.5 GPA each semester.
3. Scholarship must be used within one academic year.
4. Re-application necessary each academic year more...

For the rodeo portion, the recipient must satisfactorily participate as a member of the Tarleton Rodeo Association and maintain at least a 2.5 GPA. more...

Aligarh Alumni Association Of Dallas Fort Worth (Aaadfw) Scholarship
This scholarship is available to both undergraduate and graduate students who demonstrate academic excellence and financial need with a preference for students who received all or part of their preparatory education in one of the following countries: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan or Sri Lanka and/or students who take or have taken at least a 3 credit-hour course in South Asian Studies or Urdu Language.
Members of the Aligarh Alumni Association of Dallas Fort Worth (AAADFW) work to improve the educational and socio-economic conditions of talented and deserving students in the US and India. Members raise money to support education to assist students in preparing for entrance to Colleges and Universities and in support of scholarships. more...

Allan Saxe Health Related Scholarship Program
College of Science – Health Professions The Allan Saxe Health Related Scholarship is for students enrolled in Nursing or Pre-Med studies. They shall be of a high moral character, have maintained academic excellence, and show promise of success in their chosen health area. Financial need will be considered but will not be the sole determinant. This scholarship will be awarded in the spring 2022 semester and applied to the award recipient’s student account for fall 2022 and spring 2023. The student must be enrolled in fall 2022 and spring 2023 and continue to be in good academic standing to receive the funds from this scholarship. Students graduating in spring or summer 2022 are not eligible to apply. more...

Alton "Pete" And Charleen Pettiet Honorary Scholarship
This scholarship endowment was established by Bradley Pettiet to honor his parents Alton “Pete” and Charleen Pettiet for their long-time support and involvement in education and especially South Plains College. Mr. Pettiet, a native of Ropesville and graduate of Ropes High School, has served as a member of the SPC Board of Regents since March 1989. The Pettiets have worked in agricultural chemical sales and in agency insurance. Brad Pettiet, a 1978 graduate of SPC, is a practicing attorney in Lubbock. The scholarship is awarded to an outstanding graduate of Ropes High School who is an incoming freshman at SPC. To be eligible, applicants must enroll in a minimum of 12 semester credit hours and maintain a minimum 2.5 grade point average. more...

Alton G. Brieger (Sb6045)
The Alton G. Brieger Scholarship is available to undergraduate students that are majoring in History and who have completed 30 hrs at Texas State. It is available to transfer and continuing students. Applicants must have an overall GPA of 3.0 and a 3.3 GPA in history.
Applicants must have completed one of the following courses within the history department: Hist2310; Hist2320; Hist2311; Hist2312 and/or an Advance Elective at @300 or @400 level.
Applicants must have completed at least 30 hours at Texas State University.
Applicants must submit an essay of 750 to 1000 words that examines how the study of history might affect an applicant’s future career plans and/or what , if any, effect it might have on the applicant’s ability to impact the world around them. In addition, the applicant should also share how their experiences within the History Department at Texas State has affected their decision to have a career in history.
Applicants must provide references from three (3) people as follows
One should be a teacher whose specialty is the same as or most similar to the applicant’s major
One should be a teacher who can describe the applicant’s academic abilities.
One should be an individual who can best provide a description of those personal qualities and attributes that make the applicant a suitable recipient. (relatives are not considered suitable references.
If applying for multiple History Department Scholarships, you may utilize the same essay and references for all applications.
Brieger Scholars are required
to maintain an overall GPA of 3.0
to maintain a semester by semester GPA of 3.3 in history.
to register for and complete at least 12 hours per semester.
Failure to comply will constitute grounds for forfeiture of the Brieger Scholarship. more...

Alumni Legacy Scholarship
This is offered through the Scholarships Office. Celebrating family traditions of attending UT Arlington, current students who are directly related to a UT Arlington graduate (child, stepchild, sibling, or grandchild) may apply for this scholarship. The scholarship requires a minimum cumulative UTA GPA of 3.0 and sustained leadership, academic, extracurricular, and community activities. more...

Alumni Lettermen-Dr. James H. Atkinson Scholarship
Scholarship for college sophomores enrolled full-time at Blinn College. Students must participate in athletics. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Alumni Scholarship-Engineering
Annual award for undergraduate sophomore or higher student attending Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas, majoring in Engineering Technology. Renewable. more...

Alumni Scholarships
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors planning to attend the University of Houston. Applicants must rank in the top 25% of their high school graduating class, have a minimum SAT of 1270 or a minimum ACT of 29. Renewable. more...

Alumni-Presidential Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Virginia Polytechnic Institute & State University (Virginia Tech) who are enrolled in the universitys Honors Program. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA, live in the Hillcrest Community, be involved in a major leadership project, and be mentors to first-year honor students. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Alvin & Lucy Owsley Foundation
Annual award for a graduating Texas high school senior who has participated in a University Interscholastic League (UIL) Academic State Meet contest and is planning to attend, full-time, an accredited Texas college/university the fall semester after graduation. Students who competed in past State Meets as underclassmen and are now graduating may also apply. Consideration is also given to leadership abilities, participation in school and community activities and financial need. Applications are available for download on TILFs website, or are included in the One-Act Play participants passes packet, or may be picked up at the State Meet Registration Center, or student can send request for one beginning March 1st by sending a self-addressed (9-1/2x4) envelope with two first class stamps. Applications must be submitted and post-marked between April 1st and May 9th. Nonrenewable. more...

Alvin And Mary Walker Memorial Scholarship
The Alvin and Mary Walker Memorial Scholarship is awarded to a freshman or sophomore student who is a graduate of a high school located in Hockley County. Minimum qualifications include: 2.50 grade point average; full-time enrollment (12 semester hours or more); and U.S. citizen or permanent resident. This scholarship program was established by the friends and family of the late Alvin and Mary K. (Franklin) Walker. Both were graduates of Pep High School and attended South Plains College. Mr. Walker worked many years for K-Bar Texas Electric before his death in 1990. Mrs. Walker served as Hockley County Clerk until her death in 2003. more...

Alvin G. & Barbara A. Davis Rodeo Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students attending Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. Selection is based on academic merit and the contribution student has made to Tech Rodeo. Due dates are March 1 (fall) and October 1 (spring). Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Selection based on academic achievement. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

• Minimum 2.25 GPA in all college work.
• Register in Engineering, Information Technology, Global Supply Chain Management, Automation Robotics, or Game Development.
• Financial need (as determined by ACC Financial Aid Office).
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Successfully complete a minimum of eight hours with a 2.25 GPA.
2. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, and books.
3. Scholarship must be used within one academic year. more...

Amy & Henry Campbell Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolling/enrolled in Central Texas College at the district campus or service area campuses who are majoring in Technology. Applicant must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and financial need. In addition to application student must submit academic transcript and a 300 word essay outlining goals, academic achievement, and community service. Award is non-renewable. Applicants need only to fill out one scholarship application form for any or all of the awards the Foundation offers. Contact the Financial Aid Office for more information and/or application. more...

Amy Drennan Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship endowment was established by Chad and Jody Drennan of Levelland, Texas in memory of Mr. Drennan’s sister Amy Lynn Drennan who died in March 2010. Prior to a life-changing incident at age 14 that left her disabled for 20 years, Amy had planned to attend South Plains College to study to become a public school teacher, specializing in deaf education. In order to be considered for the scholarship, candidates must be a returning sophomore (at least 30 semester credit hours completed), have a cumulative grade point average of at least 2.50, and enroll full-time as a teacher education major. First preference will be given to a student who have been honorably discharged from any branch of the U.S. Armed Forces and who plans to major in teacher education. This preference allows the award to be awarded to an entering freshman student. more...

Amy Jean (Allen) & John A. Roberson Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for sophomores, juniors or seniors attending Washington State University who are majoring in Apparel/Textiles, Human Development or Human Nutrition. Selection based on GPA, SAT score, an essay, leadership abilities, and potential. Award amounts range from $100-$4,000. Number of awards may vary. Contact the College of Agricultural, Human, and Natural Resource Sciences for more information. more...

Amy Shields Scholarship
This scholarship is for the benefit of students who are Nutrition majors with a minimum GPA of 2.5 or higher. more...

Andersen Gruhlkey Memorial Scholarship
Andersen Gruhlkey, a graduate of Whiteface High School and South Plains College, was pursuing a degree from West Texas A & M University at the time of his passing in 2019. He was also employed at First Bank and Trust (formerly AimBank) in Levelland and was a member of The Heights Fellowship in Lubbock. From an outpouring of memorial gifts, this endowment was created to memorialize a beautiful soul. Recipient must be a graduate from one of the high schools in SPC’s service area that is classified as 3A or smaller, incoming freshman, and must have and maintain a grade point average of 2.5 or higher. more...

Anderson Scholarship

Award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the Sociology Department for more information. more...

Andres Alcantar Endowed Scholarship
Purpose: To assist incoming freshmen who are focusing on STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) programs.
Criteria:
• Enrolled in a STEM program at ACC that leads to a certificate, associate degree or transfer to a four year college or university.
• Minimum 3.0 high school GPA.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office).
Terms of Scholarship:
1. May be used for any STEM program at ACC that leads to a certificate or associate degree or transfer to a four year college or university.
2. Successfully complete a minimum of six hours with a 3.0 GPA each semester.
3. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, and books.
4. Scholarship must be used within one academic year. more...

Ann Deardorf Memorial Scholarship
The Ann Deardorf Memorial Scholarship is awarded to a freshman or sophomore student who is enrolled in the Child Development program. To be eligible, students must have a minimum 2.50 grade point average, enroll full-time (12 semester hours or more) in the Child Development program and be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Selection is made by program faculty. The scholarship honors Ann Deardorf who taught child development at the SPC downtown Lubbock Campus from 1980 until her death in 1984. The scholarship program was established by memorial gifts from family and friends. more...

Ann H. Benham Endowed Scholarship
The Ann H. Benham Endowed Scholarship shall be used for the College of Science to fund scholarships for deserving undergraduate students in the College of Science.
This scholarship will be awarded in the spring 2022 semester and applied to the award recipient’s student account in equal disbursements between Fall 2022 and Spring 2023. The student must be enrolled in Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 and continue to be in good academic standing and a COS major to receive this full scholarship award. more...

Annette Davis-Smith Memorial And Aaron C. Smith Honorary Scholarship
This scholarship program honors the memory of Dr. Annette Davis-Smith who developed South Plains College’s Associate of Arts in Teaching Degree program and taught in the program for 14 years. It was established by her husband Aaron Smith of Sundown and her mother Sarah A. “Toni” Ivy of Lubbock. The scholarship recognizes an outstanding student enrolled in the AAT program who plans to become a public school teacher. To be considered, applications must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident, plan to enroll in at least six semester credit hours in the AAT program, and maintain a minimum 2.50 grade point average. Recipients are chosen for the scholarship by faculty in the program. Dr. Smith was known for her dedication and service to the college and her students. She was instrumental in establishing the transfer partnership between South Plains College and the Texas Tech University College of Education. This partnership was recognized by the Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board with the Texas Higher Education Star Award in 2008. Dr. Davis-Smith died in 2018. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Angelo State University College of Sciences Nursing Department. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Arlington Nursing Student Association (Ansa) Endowment For Scholarship And Awards
The Arlington Nursing Student Association Endowment for Scholarship and Awards supports students in the College of Nursing at The University of Texas at Arlington BSN program.
Eligibility:
*ANSA member in good standing
Must be currently enrolled in the UT Arlington College of Nursing in any BSN program who have completed the first Junior semester of courses
Have a 3.25 GPA or better for nursing BSN courses
Participate in a minimum of two (2) pre-approved ANSA events in the semester prior to application for this scholarship (including projects on and off campus, recruitment of member and leadership initiative)
*Note: All scholarship offer notifications will be sent via your UTA email account ONLY. Please check it frequently. Scholarships are not awarded in the summer. Applications submitted during the Spring are awarded in the Fall and applications submitted in the Fall are awarded in the Spring. After submitting your application, please confirm application was submitted. Only completed applications will be considered. *
Additional questions or concerns, email nursingscholarships@uta.edu. more...

Army Rotc Scholarship
Annual award for ROTC students who are undergraduates attending Texas Christian University (TCU) in Fort Worth, Texas. In addition to the award for all or part of tuition, students will receive between $250-$400 per month for up to ten months each year, plus a $600 allowance for books and fees. Recipients will receive a room and board grant worth $4800 if they score above an 1100 on the SAT or 24 on the ACT, or transfer to TCU with a 3.25 GPA. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Award amounts range from $100-$4,000. Number of awards may vary. Contact the College of Agricultural, Human, and Natural Resource Sciences for more information. more...

Art Competition Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen or undergraduate students attending Texas A&M; International University. Applicants must submit an artwork entry, no larger than 22 x 28 and no smaller than 11 x 17 on illustration board or paper (mounted on cardboard or foamcore). First, second and third place winners will be awarded $1000, $750 and $500 respectively. Three $250 awards given to honorable mention winners. All winning entries will become the property of Texas A&M; International University. more...

Arthur And Lula Quest Memorial Scholarship
The Arthur and Lula Quest Memorial Scholarship is a general college scholarship program that was established through a generous bequest from the estate of Ruby Quest Urban of Lubbock, Texas. Ms. Urban established the scholarship program in memory of her parents who were business leaders in the Lubbock community. Minimum qualifications include: 2.50 grade point average; full-time or part-time enrollment (6 semester hours or more) in an associate degree program; and U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Consideration is given to financial need in awarding the scholarship. Additionally, scholarships are made available to students who major in pre-engineering at SPC. more...

Selection is determined by the History Department professors. Due date and number of awards vary. Contact the University or Foundation for more information and/or application. more...

Arthur R. Poor Graduate Scholarship In Civil Engineering
College of Engineering – Civil Engineering Construction Research Center The Arthur R. Poor Graduate Scholarship was established in January 1991 to honor the memory of the late Arthur R. Poor, Associate Director of the Construction Research Center and Professor of Civil Engineering at the University of Texas at Arlington. The scholarship provides support for qualified graduate students in the Civil Engineering Department. Recipients must be pursuing a Master’s degree or PhD in CE, have unconditional admission, and be a US citizen or permanent resident. Master’s students must have a 3.2 GPA on their last 60 hours of major undergraduate course work and a 300 GRE. PhD students must have a 3.5 GPA on courses taken during their Master’s program and a 320 GRE. more...

Arts & Science Merit Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students (not freshmen) attending Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas, majoring in Arts and Sciences or Pre-Professional Health. Applicants must have high academic achievement. Candidates cannot be receiving a Presidential or Presidential Plus award. Number of awards varies. Renewable; up to 4 years. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students (not incoming freshmen) attending Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas, majoring in Arts and Sciences or Pre-Professional Health. Applicants must have demonstrated financial need, good character and academic potential to succeed. Candidates cannot be receiving a Presidential or Presidential Plus award. Arturo V. & Elvira D. Lozano Scholarship
Annual award for a graduating Texas high school senior who has participated in a University Interscholastic League (UIL) Academic State Meet contest and is planning to attend, full-time, an accredited Texas college/university the fall semester after graduation. Students who competed in past State Meets as underclassmen and are now graduating may also apply. Consideration is also given to leadership abilities, participation in school and community activities and financial need. Applications are available for download on TILFs website, or are included in the One-Act Play participants passes packet, or may be picked up at the State Meet Registration Center, or student can send request for one beginning March 1st by sending a self-addressed (9-1/2x4) envelope with two first class stamps. Applications must be submitted and post-marked between April 1st and May 9th. Renewable. more...

Arvie E. Walker, Jr. Scholarship
Established by James and Robbie Walker of Lubbock, this scholarship honors Mr. Walker’s father Arvie Walker. Mr. Walker graduated from Texas Tech University in 1948 and worked as a surface geologist in the White Flat field near Abilene, Texas before sitting on wells and examining well-bore samples. His career began with Sun Oil Company before he became an independent geologist. He was involved in oil and gas exploration in Texas, New Mexico, Kentucky and West Virginia over the span of his career. Jim Walker worked 22 years at South Plains College as dean of continuing education and workforce development and later retired as vice president for academic affairs in 2015. Mrs. Walker served as a public school teacher and librarian in Lubbock and Levelland. The scholarship recognizes an outstanding student who is pursuing studies in geology or in the physical sciences. In order to be considered for the scholarship, the applicant must be a U.S. Citizen and/or permanent resident, must enroll as a full-time student (minimum 12 semester credit hours), and must have and maintain at least a 2.50 cumulative grade point average. more...

Asa Lubbock Chapter Scholarship In Automotive Technology
The Lubbock Chapter of the Automotive Service Association has made this scholarship possible to be awarded to a second-year Automotive Technology student. Minimum qualifications include: 2.50 grade point average; full-time enrollment (12 semester hours or more) in the business program; and U.S. citizen or permanent resident. more...

• Minimum 3.0 GPA in college coursework.
• Demonstrate strong leadership skills.
• Exhibit effective communication skills.

3. Scholarship must be used within one academic year.

College of Engineering – Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering Department: The ASME Scholarship is open to all members of the UTA student chapter of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME).
• Must have a total of 12 ‘active member’ points or more as determined by the ASME officers
• Write an essay about their experience in ASME, how they want it to progress, and do they want to become an officer and why (give examples)
• Preference to non-officer member, ideally seeking officer role more...

Assistance League Of Austin/Suanne Davis Roueche Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students pursuing an Associate Degree in Nursing at ACC.
Criteria:
• Accepted into and enrolled in the ACC Associate Degree of Nursing program or entering second year of the program.
• Minimum 2.5 GPA overall.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office).
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Successfully complete the required semester hours in the nursing curriculum with a minimum 2.5 GPA.
2. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, and nursing program expenses (immunizations, uniforms, equipment, board exams….)
3. Scholarship must be used within one academic year. more...

Assistance League Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students enrolled in an Applied Science program at Austin Community College.
Criteria:
• 2.5 GPA in high school or college or submit a GED.
• Minimum of 12 college credit hours.
• Register in an Applied Science certificate or degree program at ACC.
• Financial need (as determined by ACC Financial Aid Office).
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Accept a mentor from Assistance League® of Austin.
2. Scholarship will apply to tuition, fees, and books up to the designated amount.
3. Submit degree plan.
4. Enroll in and successfully complete a minimum of six hours on degree plan with a 2.5 GPA each semester while on scholarship.
5. Scholarship must be used within one academic year.
6. A student may re-take a course one time while on scholarship. The scholarship will not pay for any course a student enrolls in three or more times.
7. If student is awaiting acceptance to an Applied Sciences program and has completed the required pre-requisite courses, the student may take courses applicable to a baccalaureate degree with the following conditions:
a. Student must provide degree plan from intended college or university to ensure the coursework is applicable for their desired 4 year degree.
b. Student may take up to two semesters of coursework toward a baccalaureate degree while waiting admission to an ACC Applied Science program. Student will not receive scholarship funds for more than two semesters of coursework not on their ACC degree plan. more...

Austin Classical Guitar Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students enrolled in the ACC Music Program who show musical ability in guitar.
Criteria:
• Minimum 2.5 GPA in Music courses and 2.5 GPA overall.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office).
• One letter of recommendation from a classical guitar instructor
• An essay indicating musical background and future goals.
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, books, and supplies.
2. Successfully complete a minimum of nine hours with a 3.0 GPA in Music courses and a 2.5 overall GPA each semester while on scholarship.
3. Scholarship must be used within the academic year it was awarded.
4. Re-application necessary each academic year. more...

Austin Hotel & Lodging Association Hospitality Management Scholarship
Purpose: To assist students enrolled in the ACC Hospitality Management or Travel & Tourism program.
Criteria:
• Hospitality Management or Travel & Tourism major.
• Successfully completed at least one course in the Hospitality Management or Travel & Tourism program with a grade of C or better.
• Currently enrolled at ACC with an overall 3.0 GPA for all college coursework taken within the last three years.
• Include maximum 300 word essay addressing your career goals in the Hospitality field.
• Provide one letter of recommendation from a school official, professor, or advisor who can discuss your academic status, academic achievements, and personal qualities such as maturity, motivation, leadership, commitment, and potential for future success.
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Recipient chosen by the Hospitality Management Scholarship Committee.
2. Maintain at least a 3.0 GPA each semester and overall.
3. Maintain a minimum grade of C in all Hospitality Management courses during scholarship award.
4. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, and books.
5. Scholarship must be used within one academic year.
6. Re-application necessary each academic year. more...

Band Scholarship
This scholarship will be given to students participating in band. Recipients shall be full-time students with a 2.50 overall GPA and a 3.0 GPA in music. Probation may be granted at the discretion of the department head.
This award is contingent on the following:
1, students must participate in the ensembles as assigned by the Director of Bands based on successful audition
2, all students must audition for the fall semester Wind Ensemble/Chamber Winds
3, applicable students must audition for Jazz Band
4, all students must participate in Marching Band (a students is only allowed to not participate if permission is granted by the Director of Bands)
5, active membership and satisfactory progress in assigned ensembles
6, no unexcused absences from any performance or rehearsal
By accepting this scholarship, students are also agreeing to the following:
1, I acknowledge that it is my responsibility to notify Tarleton State University if I accept any other offers prior to May 1 of the acceptance year.
2, I acknowledge that after May 1 of the acceptance year, I may not consider offers from other member schools of the Texas Association of Music Schools unless I obtain written consent from the Tarleton State University Department of Fine Arts.
3, In the event I am unable to fulfill all of the conditions stated above, I will forfeit my scholarship immediately. Repayment of forfeited scholarship money will be in accordance with current Tarleton State University policy. more...

Scholarship for Texas residents who are full-time undergraduate or graduate students attending the University of Houston enrolled in the Bauer College of Business. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA for graduate studies or a minimum 3.0 GPA for undergraduate studies and have a minimum 1200 SAT score or 600 GMAT score and show leadership and community initiative. Barbara Jordan Scholarship

Barbara Jordan Scholarship Fund
College of Liberal Arts. The Barbara Jordan Scholarship was established in 2005 by the Greater Arlington/Mansfield Democratic Women. Barbara Jordan, the first woman elected to the Texas Senate and the first African-American elected to represent Texas in the U.S. House of Representatives, supported public education, decent housing, civil rights, gender equality, a living wage and protection of the environment. The scholarship is designed to provide financial assistance to students who meet specific criteria:
Junior or Senior classification when they receive the award, students may apply while they are sophomores. Students must take a minimum of 12 hours a semester for the life of the award.
Minimum 3.0 GPA

Declared major in political science, history, or sociology
Leadership potential
Demonstrated financial need according to financial aid guidelines following submission of FAFSA

Full time status.
Application materials shall include a recommendation letter from two faculty, a short essay describing the applicant’s goals, a statement of career/social/personal interests; a vita/resume showing academic and community service achievement; and an essay response to one of the following:
What do you consider to be Barbara Jordan’s most significant political and social achievement?
How did she effect political change in the US?
How has her life and accomplishments influenced you?
Additional letters of recommendation may come from employers and/or community leaders.
*A student who receives this award may reapply one time. more...

Scholarship for full-time college sophomores, juniors and seniors attending Southwestern College. Applicants must demonstrate financial need. Due dates are June 1 and December 1. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Eligibility for this College of Business – Accounting endowment is as follows:
Be a declared accounting major currently enrolled in a minimum of nine semester hours at the University of Texas at Arlington.
Have completed a minimum of fifteen (15) semester hours of accounting courses at the University of Texas at Arlington.
Have achieved a minimum GPA of 3.0 overall in courses completed at UTA and a minimum GPA of 3.0 in accounting courses completed at UTA and be judged capable of completing a baccalaureate degree in accounting at UTA; and be a citizen of the United States. more...

Barry And Rene Heard Scholarship
The Barry and Rene Heard Scholarship is a general college scholarship that is awarded to a freshman student who is a graduate of Whitharral High School. Minimum qualifications include: 2.50 grade point average; full-time enrollment (12 semester hours or more); and U.S. citizen or permanent resident. The Heards, who have a long-time association with South Plains College, have established an endowed scholarship program that assists an incoming student. Mr. Heard, who grew up in the Whitharral community, has farmed in Hockley County for many years. The Heards’ two children attended SPC, and Mrs. Heard retired from South Plains College with 21 years of service. more...

Purpose: To assist students enrolled in the ACC Visual Communication program.
Criteria:
• Minimum 2.5 GPA overall.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office).
• Declared major in Visual Communication at ACC.
• Successfully completed one of these introductory courses prior to receiving the scholarship:
• ARTC 1413 Digital Publishing I
• ARTC 1305 Basic Graphic Design
• ARTC 1409 Basic Illustration
• ARTC 1402 Digital Imaging I
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Maintain a 3.0 GPA overall while on scholarship.
2. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, and books.
3. May only be used toward a degree or certificate in Visual Communication at ACC.
4. Scholarship must be used within one academic year.
5. Re-application necessary each academic year. more...

Bethany Loper Memorial Scholarship In Music
This scholarship endowment was established by the family of Bethany Loper, who was a sophomore music student at South Plains College when she died in an automobile accident on her way home in 2013. Loper graduated from Holliday High School where she was actively involved in music and UIL journalism and news writing and won many district and state titles. In order to be considered for the scholarship, students must enroll full-time at SPC as a creative arts or fine arts music major and have at least a 2.5 grade point average. more...

Betty Baker Nursing Scholarship
This scholarship is intended for an undergraduate student pursuing a major in nursing at SFA . Each scholarship candidate shall prepare a case study or research paper regarding the control and treatment of cardiomyopathy. The case study or research paper should consist of approximately 6 -10 pages or more including footnotes and bibliography and be turned in no later than the February 1, by midnight, for the scholarship committee to review . The scholarship committee of Nursing shall review the case study and/or research papers based on the depth and content of the research. more...

Betty Bell Scholarship

Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA (undergraduate) or 3.0 (graduate). Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Betty Fagan Burr Scholarship
This scholarship is for the benefit of students with an Accounting (CPA) major, who are female and have a GPA of 3.0 or higher. more...

Betty Ford Scholarship
This scholarship is for the benefit of male students who are Business majors with a GPA of 2.5 or higher. Students must have graduated from Nacogdoches or Marion county ISD and be the son of a single mother. more...

Betty Hall Memorial
General scholarship given in memory of Betty Hall by her sons, Mark and Paul Hall and should be a Baytown Christian Academy graduate and going into Honors program at Lee College. Second choice, just graduate of BCA. Third choice, graduate of a private school. Student must be enrolled in one or more honors courses and/or students who have signed an honors contract more...

Betty Smothers Broadhurst Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolling/enrolled in Central Texas College at the district campus or service area campuses. Applicant must have financial need. In addition to application student must submit a financial aid form, academic transcript, and a 300 word essay outlining goals, academic achievement, and community service. Applicants need only to fill out one scholarship application form for any or all of the awards the Foundation offers. Contact the Financial Aid Office for more information and/or application. more...

Selection based on academic achievement (minimum 3.0 GPA) and potential. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Contact the College of Sciences for more information. more...

Bg Brinegar Family "Lead The Way" Scholarship
This scholarship will be given to a full-time, sophomore participating in the Corps of Cadets with a minimum grade point average of 2.8. Recipients must be seeking an undergraduate degree as well as a commission in the Armed Forces. Four and three year Army or Air Force ROTC Scholarship recipients are not eligible to apply. The intent of this scholarship is to be used toward housing in the Tarleton Corps of Cadets Residential Living Hall. more...

The Bhupat and Jyoti Mehta Family Foundation Scholarship is open to full-time international students enrolled in the College of Business at the University of Houston. You must have a minimum 3.5 GPA, demonstrate financial need, and be recommended by your professor to qualify for this award. more...

Big Brothers Big Sisters Of Tarrant County Scholarship
Annual award for current or previous members of Big Brothers or Sister who are undergraduate students attending the Texas Christian University (TCU) in Fort Worth, Texas. Preference will be given to male minority applicants. Applicants must have demonstrated financial need (as established by their FAFSA application). Incoming freshmen must have ranked in the top 25% of their high school class. Transfer students and current TCU students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Bilingual Ec-6 Teacher Certification Scholarship
College of Education The Center for Bilingual Education/ELS Education is taking applications for scholarships to prepare bilingual and ESL teachers. The program is to be funded by the UTA IPAT project. PURPOSE: To prepare junior/senior bilingual and ESL education teacher candidates.
Requirements: Candidates will required to donate a minimum of two hours a week to mentor high school students.
Minimum Qualifications to Apply:
1.A grade point average of 3.00 on a scale of 4
2.Evidence of the minimum THEA Scores: Reading 270, Math 230, Writing 220
3.Proficiency in Spanish and English interview required
4.Full-time students 12 hours or more per semester
5.Complete Transcript showing an associate degree or equivalent
6.Must qualify to receive federal financial funding more...

Bill And Tilley Wasson Endowment For Study Abroad Programs
College of Liberal Arts The Bill and Tilley Wasson Endowment for Study Abroad Programs was established by Wallace Dale Wasson and Kimberly P. Van Noort to provide scholarship awards to assist undergraduate students in good academic standing at the time of application with the expense of participating in a study abroad program. Preference will be given to first generation students who demonstrate financial need. Recipients must be full time students pursuing a degree from the College of Liberal Arts and may not be seeking a degree from the Honors College nor have studied abroad via a UT Arlington program. Award levels shall be determined by the Dean of the College of Liberal Arts or his/her designee.
INCLUDED IN THE CRITERIA FOR AWARDING THIS SCHOLARSHIP IS “DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED" WHICH REQUIRES THE COMPLETION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). IF YOU HAVE NOT COMPLETED THIS FORM, PLEASE GO TO http://www.uta.edu/fao/ FOR FURTHER INFORMATION AND ASSISTANCE. more...

Bill Ross Accounting Alumni Endowed Scholarship
College of Business – Accounting The Bill Ross Accounting Alumni Endowed Scholarship was established to recognize Dr. Bill Ross for the significant contributions he made to the University of Texas at Arlington while serving on the accounting faculty.
Eligibility:
Declared Accounting major currently enrolled or intending to enroll in a minimum of 9 semester hours at UT Arlington
Completed 15 semester hours of accounting courses at UT Arlington or have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university.
Achieved a minimum overall GPA of 3.2 and a minimum GPA of 3.5 in accounting courses completed at an accredited college or university and be pursuing or intending to pursue a baccalaureate or master degree in accounting at UT Arlington.
Be a citizen of the US or a permanent resident. more...

Bill Snodgrass Endowed Scholarship

Bill Waeltz Memorial Scholarship
Purpose: To assist ACC students interested in pursuing a Bachelor of Science degree in civil engineering or a related engineering field at a four year college or university.
Criteria:
• High school graduate with at least 3.0 GPA out of a 4.0 scale and an A/B average in math and science courses in high school, or have equivalent GED scores.
• Enrolled in the ACC Engineering degree program, A & E CAD Civil Engineering Specialization or taking core coursework to transfer to a four year college or university.
• In good academic standing at ACC.
• U.S. Citizen or legal non-citizen resident.
• Financial need (as determined by the ACC Financial Aid Office).
• Preference given to students who have graduated from a Round Rock ISD high school.
Terms of Scholarship:
• Successfully complete a minimum of six hours with a 3.0 GPA each semester.
• Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, and books.
• Scholarship must be used within one academic year.
• Re-application necessary each academic year. more...

Billy Sheek Memorial Scholarship
The Billy Sheek Memorial Scholarship program is awarded to a freshman or sophomore student who majors in agriculture sciences. Minimum qualifications include: 2.50 grade point average; full-time enrollment (12 semester hours or more) in the agriculture program; and U.S. Citizen or permanent resident. Recipients are chosen by the agriculture faculty. The late Mrs. Cora Sanders of Levelland established the Billy Sheek Memorial Scholarship in Agriculture in memory of her grandson who majored in agribusiness at SPC prior to his death. more...

Biology Founding Faculty Scholarship

Some of these professors included Henry Lucke, J.B. Balch, Scott Couch, Polly Parmer, Glenna Cooper and Jim Blassingame. The scholarship is awarded to an outstanding biology major who enrolls as a full-time student and who maintains a 3.0 grade point average. more...

Bliss Family Scholarship
This scholarship endowment has been established by Tony and Tess Bliss of Lubbock, Texas, who believe that South Plains College provides a quality education for area students. In order to be eligible, applicants must be U.S. citizens or permanent residents and plan to enroll in at least six semester hours of coursework at SPC with first preference given to pre-medicine majors and second preference given to enrollment in any career or technical educational program. Preference is also given to students who are first-generation college students. Recipients must have and maintain a minimum grade point average of 2.0. Mr. and Mrs. Bliss established the scholarship to expand opportunities for students to receive a college education in order to be useful and productive members of society. more...

Bob Beck Scholarship In Chemistry
The Bob Beck Scholarship is awarded to an outstanding student majoring in chemistry. Minimum qualifications include: 3.00 grade point average; full-time enrollment (12 semester hours or more); and U.S. citizen or permanent resident. This scholarship honors Bob Beck, professor of chemistry. Professor Beck joined the SPC faculty in the fall of 1959. He taught 37 years in the Science Department, which included 15 years as department chairman. He retired in 1996. Professor Beck was named to receive the Faculty Excellence Award in 1969. Through the generosity of Science Department faculty, former students and friends, the scholarship program was endowed in 2008. more...

Bob Bullock Endowed Scholarship

Bob Veretto Memorial Scholarship
The Bob Veretto Memorial Scholarship is awarded to a freshman or sophomore student who majors in finance, business or accounting. Minimum qualifications include: 2.50 grade point average; full-time enrollment (12 semester hours or more) in the business program; and U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Mr. Veretto was a Levelland business leader involved in banking and agriculture who believed in hard work and honesty. The family and friends of Mr. Veretto established the endowed scholarship program to recognize his many contributions to Levelland and Hockley County. Eleven members of his family have attended SPC. more...

Bob Wills Western Swing Scholarship
This scholarship honors western swing music legend Bob Wills and his Texas Playboys. The scholarship was established by the Lincoln County (N.M.) Cowboy Symposium Committee and has been supported through the generosity of the The Hubbard Museum of the American West and the Museum of the Horse in Ruidoso, N.M. Minimum qualifications include: 2.50 grade point average; full-time enrollment (12 semester hours or more); demonstrated musical talent through audition; and U.S. citizen or permanent resident. more...

Bobbitt Family Endowed Scholarship For The College Of Science
College of Science. The Bobbitt Family Endowed Scholarship for the College of Science shall be used for the benefit of the College of Science. Scholarship recipients must be full-time graduate students pursuing a Doctoral degree in the College of Science. Recipients must maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. This award can be awarded in subsequent years if student reapplies and is selected again by the scholarship committee and does not preclude any other financial aid. All awards will be made according to prevailing University and departmental policies and protocols.
This scholarship will be awarded in the spring 2022 semester and applied to the award recipient’s student account in equal disbursements between Fall 2022 and Spring 2023. The student must be enrolled in Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 and continue to be in good academic standing to receive this full scholarship award. more...

Boone Baker Endowed Scholarship
Purpose: To assist ACC Phi Theta Kappa members.
Criteria:
• Minimum 3.0 GPA in all college work.
• Essay explaining future goals, career goals, and community involvement. Explain what you have gained from your education at ACC.
• Member of Phi Theta Kappa ACC Honor Society.
• Worked two or more consecutive semesters before graduation. Attach a letter from current or previous employer stating employment period.
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA.
2. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees and books.
3. Scholarship must be used within one academic year.
4. Re-application necessary each academic year. more...

Boston High School Scholarship
Scholarship for Boston residents who are graduating high school seniors from Boston Public Schools planning to attend full-time at Boston University. Students must demonstrate academic achievement and leadership skills. Applicants have an average 3.7 GPA, 1315 Math SAT score, 640 Writing SAT score, or 24 ACT score, and 6% of the graduating high school class. Due date and award amount may vary. Renewable. more...

Boyd Vance Scholarship
Purpose: To assist African-American students enrolling in the ACC Dance or Drama program.
Criteria:
• Dance or Drama major.
• Must have a high school diploma or GED or 2.5 GPA for all college coursework.
• Scholarships are awarded on the basis of scholastic merit, artistic promise, and need for financial assistance.
Terms of Scholarship:
1. Recipient chosen by Dance and Drama Department Scholarship Committee.
2. Successfully complete a minimum of 2 courses towards a dance or drama degree plan (includes core classes) with a 2.5 GPA each semester.
3. Scholarship applies to tuition, fees, books and required materials.
4. Recipients must sign an agreement stating specific involvement with the Dance and Drama Department for at least one semester. This involvement may be through performance in technical production or in management and administration. more...

Braulio, Hilda & Jose Cuesta Memorial Scholarship
The Braulio, Hilda and Jose Cuesta Memorial Scholarship is awarded to students who pursue a career in psychology, child development or pre-medicine. Minimum qualifications include: 2.50 grade point average; full-time enrollment (12 semester hours or more); and U.S. citizen or permanent resident. The scholarship program was established by the family and friends of Dr. and Mrs. B.J. Cuesta and Dr. Jose Cuesta, their son. Dr. B.J. Cuesta practiced general medicine in Levelland for 22 years until his death in 1988. Dr. Jose Cuesta was a child psychiatrist in Houston at the time of his death. Mrs. Cuesta died in 2009. more...

Brian Philip Joseph Labarbera Memorial Scholarship
